content:
TITLE: Updated GRPCIO Secure Connection - Rust
DESCRIPTION: New implementation of establishing secure connections to Google Cloud Platform using GRPCIO library. Uses set_credentials instead of secure_connect and includes updated message size limits.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mozilla-services/google-cloud-rust/blob/master/googleapis-raw/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: rust
CODE:
```
let channel = ChannelBuilder::new(Arc::clone(&env))
        .max_send_message_len(100 << 20)
        .max_receive_message_len(100 << 20)
        .set_credentials(creds)  // note the new, dedicated function
        .connect(&endpoint);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Module Dependency Example
DESCRIPTION: Example of how to specify module dependencies in Rust mod files, demonstrating use of crate paths and IAM policy imports
SOURCE: https://github.com/mozilla-services/google-cloud-rust/blob/master/googleapis-raw/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: rust
CODE:
```
pub(crate) use crate::{
    empty,
    iam::v1::{iam_policy, policy},
    longrunning::operations,
};
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Specifying Dependencies for Google Cloud Rust Client
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the required dependencies and their versions for the Google Cloud Rust Client. It's crucial that these versions match with the calling code.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mozilla-services/google-cloud-rust/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: TOML
CODE:
```
protobuf = { version = "=2.28.0" }
grpcio = { version = "0.13.0" }
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: GRPCIO Secure Feature Configuration - TOML
DESCRIPTION: Required Cargo.toml configuration to enable secure connection feature in GRPCIO version 0.12.0.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mozilla-services/google-cloud-rust/blob/master/googleapis-raw/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: toml
CODE:
```
grpcio = {version="0.12.0" features=["_secure"]}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building the Rust Docker Container
DESCRIPTION: Command to build the Docker image using docker-compose. This creates a container with a recent Rust toolchain installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mozilla-services/google-cloud-rust/blob/master/docker/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker-compose build rust
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting and Connecting to the Rust Docker Container
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Docker container and connect to it with an interactive bash shell. The project repository is mounted into the container.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mozilla-services/google-cloud-rust/blob/master/docker/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker-compose run rust /bin/bash
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Example Applications
DESCRIPTION: Commands to run the provided Spanner and BigTable query example applications
SOURCE: https://github.com/mozilla-services/google-cloud-rust/blob/master/googleapis-raw/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
cargo run --example spanner-query
cargo run --example bigtable-query
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Protobuf Code Generator
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the protobuf code generator plugin for Rust via cargo
SOURCE: https://github.com/mozilla-services/google-cloud-rust/blob/master/googleapis-raw/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
cargo install protobuf-codegen
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating API Documentation in Rust
DESCRIPTION: Command to generate and open cargo documentation for the project
SOURCE: https://github.com/mozilla-services/google-cloud-rust/blob/master/googleapis-raw/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
cargo doc --open
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Legacy GRPCIO Secure Connection - Rust
DESCRIPTION: Previous implementation of establishing secure connections to Google Cloud Platform using GRPCIO library. Sets message size limits and uses secure_connect for authentication.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mozilla-services/google-cloud-rust/blob/master/googleapis-raw/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: rust
CODE:
```
 let channel = ChannelBuilder::new(Arc::clone(env))
        // Set the max size to correspond to server-side limits.
        .max_send_message_len(1 << 28)
        .max_receive_message_len(1 << 28)
        .secure_connect(&endpoint, creds);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Git Submodules
DESCRIPTION: Commands for updating the gRPC and related submodules to latest versions
SOURCE: https://github.com/mozilla-services/google-cloud-rust/blob/master/googleapis-raw/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git submodule update --remote grpc
pushd grpc/third_party
git submodule update --remote protobuf
git submodule update --remote googleapis
popd
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Formatting Git Commit Message in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the proper format for a git commit message, including the header, body, and footer. It showcases how to structure the commit message with a type, subject, detailed description, breaking changes, and issue references.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mozilla-services/google-cloud-rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
```
feat: give the developers a delicious cookie

Properly formatted commit messages provide understandable history and
documentation. This patch will provide a delicious cookie when all tests have
passed and the commit message is properly formatted.

BREAKING CHANGE: This patch requires developer to lower expectations about
    what "delicious" and "cookie" may mean. Some sadness may result.

Closes #3.14, #9.75
```
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Environment Variable for mod.rs Updater in Python
DESCRIPTION: Example of how to run the mod_updater.py script with a custom path to the googleapis-raw directory using an environment variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mozilla-services/google-cloud-rust/blob/master/tools/mod_updater/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
MOD_UP_PATH=path/to/googleapis-raw python3 mod_updater.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Apache 2.0 License Header for Google Cloud Rust Project
DESCRIPTION: The standard Apache License 2.0 header used at the beginning of source files in the Google Cloud Rust project. It indicates that the code is copyrighted by Google LLC as of 2020 and specifies the license terms under which the code can be used.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mozilla-services/google-cloud-rust/blob/master/googleapis/LICENSE.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
# Copyright 2020 Google LLC
#
# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
# you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
# You may obtain a copy of the License at
#
#     https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
#
# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
# distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
# See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
# limitations under the License.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Apache License 2.0 Header for Google Cloud Rust Project
DESCRIPTION: The standard copyright and license header for the Google Cloud Rust project. It specifies that the code is licensed under Apache License 2.0, which allows usage, modification, and distribution under specific conditions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mozilla-services/google-cloud-rust/blob/master/googleapis-raw/LICENSE.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
# Copyright 2020 Google LLC
#
# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
# you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
# You may obtain a copy of the License at
#
#     https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
#
# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
# distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
# See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
# limitations under the License.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Apache License 2.0 Terms for Google Cloud Rust Project
DESCRIPTION: This snippet outlines the copyright notice and licensing terms for the Google Cloud Rust project. It specifies that the project is licensed under Apache License 2.0, providing terms for use, reproduction, and distribution of the software.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mozilla-services/google-cloud-rust/blob/master/LICENSE.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Text
CODE:
```
# Copyright 2020 Google LLC
#
# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
# you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
# You may obtain a copy of the License at
#
#     https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
#
# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
# distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
# See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
# limitations under the License.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Commenting HTML Block in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This HTML comment block is used to provide a placeholder for project-specific etiquette guidelines. It suggests updating the content for the specific project if needed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mozilla-services/google-cloud-rust/blob/master/googleapis/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: HTML
CODE:
```
<!--
## Project Specific Etiquette

In some cases, there will be additional project etiquette i.e.: (https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/page.cgi?id=etiquette.html).
Please update for your project.
-->
```
